12.2.17  2:47 am   How does one stay true to themself?

     it's the default setting. but sometimes it's good to go in there and make sure no one has messed with the settings

12.2.17  1:25 am   why does love hurt so much?

     because it's so important

12.1.17  11:43 pm   got any advice for an audition?

     do it like you've done a million auditions before. if you haven't done that many auditions yet, then make sure you do some more auditions. and the good news is it doesn't matter if you get them, because the goal is just to get better at auditions. and soon you will be so good at auditions you will win them all. then the next challenge will be how to fit all your new gigs into your schedule

12.1.17  11:26 pm   12 minutes into your "history of the entire world, i guess" video, when trying to recall the name 'Majapahit', you take six guesses.  I thought this was implying that you tried all 6 permutations of the three consonants 'j', 'p', 'h'.  Upon further review, your third and fifth guesses were both 'Mapajahit'?

Why do you hate the Mapahajit?  They don't even exist

     that was unintentional. indeed, it was written to include all 6 permutations, but somewhere in the haste of vocal recording and editing, embarassingly, i screwed it up. just one of the downfalls of working so fast, which was necessary because that project was so long. as it is, the entire project took 11 months to create

12.1.17  10:48 pm   Will you ever make a video about a cat?

     i have done that, at least once before

      If so what color is the cat?

     i don't remember

      What is it's name?

     the cat wasn't named, in the video

      does the cat have hobbies?

     real estate, i assume

12.1.17  10:16 pm   Every time I try to actively write music, I get  hung up on the fact that there is really a limited number of ways to write a song.

     ah, that's not true

      I'm a jazz guitarist and I know my chords super well. Every key, every extension, every inversion (thats physically possible to play). I try to rhythmically spruce up my progressions, but I really feel that the core of harmony (tonic, dominant, and predominant functional chords) is limiting. I, iii, and vi share two notes, ii and IV share two notes, and V and vii are basically interchangable. I got into modal interchange when I started to feel bored with diatonic progressions. At this point, I feel like I've emptied my bag of tricks. This is basically the ultimate struggle of composition. People have been trying to answer this question for hundreds of years. How do you combat the limitations of writing music? In other words, how do you push out so much material and still hold a constant level of creativity wit h what y ou write?

     it seems you've left out one of the most important elements of a song, and one of the strongest sources of identity and guidance, in a song. and that's WORDS

     as usual, i have revealed many many details about this project already. including the format, length, title, and much of the contents
